item.title: Oil Drifts Lower Amid Larger-Than-Expected Supply
item.description: Oil prices drifted lower in Europe, as global macroeconomic weakness and hidden supply rises helped offset recent cuts to output from OPEC and better demand in China.

item.title: Dollar Weak After Powell Comments, Could Fall Further
item.description: The dollar remained under presssure and MUFG said it risks falling further, as the absence of a more hawkish message from Powell means the U.S. rate market is comfortable to price in only one further hike at this stage.

item.title: Philippine Central Bank Holds Rates on Inflation Downtrend
item.description: The Philippine central bank kept its benchmark interest rate unchanged amid signs of easing inflation in the Southeast Asian nation.

item.title: Rival Satellite Firms End Talks
item.description: SES said it has ended talks with peer Intelsat about a possible combination, a deal that would have sought to position them better to compete with Elon Musk’s Starlink satellite-internet service.

item.title: Gold Slips as Attention Turns to China Demand
item.description: Gold prices were weaker in London as attention shifted to Chinese buying, which seems to be slowing down after strong sales earlier this year.

item.title: Ukraine Strikes Bridge Supplying Russian Troops
item.description: The attack threatens to undermine Moscow’s hold in the south of Ukraine as Kyiv presses an offensive to retake lost territory.

item.title: Explosion at Barbecue Restaurant in China Kills 31 on Eve of Holiday
item.description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping ordered stricter safety controls after the gas explosion in Ningxia.

item.title: Bank Indonesia Maintains Benchmark Rate as Expected
item.description: Indonesia’s central bank stood pat as expected during its June policy meeting as it kept the rupiah stable and as inflationary pressures have eased.

item.title: Widening Wealth Gap Drives Talks for Green Finance Pact at Paris Summit
item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron is hosting world leaders this week in a bid to overhaul financing for better environmental and development goals in poor countries.

item.title: Aegon Outlines 2025 Targets
item.description: Aegon said it aimed to increase its operating capital to around €1.2 billion in 2025, focusing its new strategy on boosting its U.S. unit’s earnings.

item.title: DS Smith Trading as Expected After Full-Year Tops Hopes
item.description: DS Smith reported above-forecast adjusted earnings of £861 million in 2023 and said current trading was in line with its expectations despite volatile economic conditions and lower than normal box volumes.

item.title: Japan's Reform Progress Could Boost Topix to 2500 in 12 Months, Goldman Says
item.description: Japan’s reform progress is likely to boost the Topix index to 2500 in 12 months, Goldman Sachs said.

item.title: Analysis: BOE Watchers Could Be Focusing Too Heavily on Inflation Data
item.description: The U.K.’s unexpectedly high inflation reading for May has raised expectations that the BOE may plump for a 50 basis-point hike at its meeting later Thursday, but some economists said forecasters could be putting too much weight on the print.

item.title: Japan Decides 'Tourism Pollution' Is Worth It as Money Floods In
item.description: After a pandemic timeout, the nation has recommitted to being a top visitor destination.

item.title: Russian Court to Hear Appeal on Journal Reporter Evan Gershkovich's Detention
item.description: The Wall Street Journal reporter had been ordered to be held in a Moscow prison until at least Aug. 30.

item.title: U.S. Offers India Drones, Jet Engines to Lure It From Russia
item.description: The switch to greater cooperation stems from India’s strategic importance in the U.S. campaign to counter China, as well as American interest in stifling Russian influence in developing nations.

item.title: SoftBank CEO Son said he has rekindled his appetite for investing in technology by talking with ChatGPT in the wee hours about ideas for inventions that the bot validated as wonderful.
item.description: SoftBank CEO Son said he has rekindled his appetite for investing in technology by talking with ChatGPT in the wee hours about ideas for inventions that the bot validated as wonderful.

item.title: Investor Richard Hurowitz, with backing from sovereign wealth manager Mubadala, has emerged as a bidder for Simon & Schuster, according to people familiar with the situation.
item.description: Investor Richard Hurowitz, with backing from sovereign wealth manager Mubadala, has emerged as a bidder for Simon & Schuster, according to people familiar with the situation.

item.title: Activist investor Elliott is ratcheting up pressure on NRG Energy and is seeking to oust the company's chief executive, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.description: Activist investor Elliott is ratcheting up pressure on NRG Energy and is seeking to oust the company’s chief executive, according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: China lashed out at Biden for describing Xi as a dictator, a remark that injected fresh discord into the relationship between the two men at a time when broader U.S.-China ties appeared on the threshold of a thaw.
item.description: China lashed out at Biden for describing Xi as a dictator, a remark that injected fresh discord into the relationship between the two men at a time when broader U.S.-China ties appeared on the threshold of a thaw.
